poem:
**Mars within Reach**

In four years' span,
he dreams of rust,
a Martian city —
self-sustained,
laughter cast like stones
at bold boasts.
But purpose blooms
in red horizons,
beyond Earth's jeers,
in silent orbit,
we are already more
than dust.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Musk says humans can be on Mars in four years. Many laugh, but some see purpose Almost buried beneath a recent avalanche of rightwing invective posted by Elon Musk on the platform he owns, X, was one eye-popping statement that made space watchers sit up and take notice: an assertion that humans could land on Mars within four years and be living there in a self-sustaining city in 20. It seemed a fanciful boast, even". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
